intro: Ilex arnhemensis subsp. ferdinandi, commonly known as the Northern Grey Box, is a shrub or small tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, grey-green foliage and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, bright red berries that are an important food source for native wildlife. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a habitat provider and its contribution to the biodiversity of its native region.
